729302f-b.text:
(1)
8E8 Richmond Avenue, adjoining the N. E. porner of Eenfrewm Place, showing the G. Houseman House uUeers's 1874 map). Mr. P. L. Snerr states that this is the house in which Polly Brodine, who was accused in a famous murder trial, lived.
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS  October 1924
(2)
A view westward
ctober 1924
P. L. Sperr
(3)
An adoitonal view, at a later dafe.
March 24, 1928
P. L. Sperr

729302f-c.folder: Richmond Avenue & Renfrew Place, Staten Island, NY

729304f-b.text:
(1)
876 Richmond Avenue, at the N. W. corner of Renfrew Place, showing the Renfrew House (Beers's 1874 map). Mr. P. L. Sperr states that it is the hose of Polly Bodine fame, in which the murder, with which her name
was connected, was committed.
About 1900
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr
(2) A view of the house, years later.
January 4, 1924
By Villiam T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
(3)
A side view of the house. This view shows some slight architectural changes from that of view 1.
October,1924
By Yilliam T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
